channel.title: Tools on Tools for Academic Research
channel.description: Recent content in Tools on Tools for Academic Research

item.title: Deepnote
item.description: Data science notebooks for teams

item.title: Open Textbooks
item.description: Free, adaptable, openly licensed textbooks and supplemental resources.

item.title: Open Scholarship Knowledge Base
item.description: Discover open scholarship resources created and curated by the community.

item.title: Bifrost AI Datasets
item.description: Search for visual datasets by task, application, class, label or format

item.title: MyMind
item.description: MyMind is an idea note, quote, page, and image collector with the usual tag-style support. You add material from the web via a capable browser plugin; but, the standout feature is AI help in your search/retrieval of information, even without tags. It displays your saved material in a card grid—think Pinterest, Pocket, and similar—with selectable density and size. A large search box sits at the top with instant results while you type.

item.title: WizdomAI
item.description: Understand the journals and institutes through publications

item.title: nomnoml
item.description: a tool for drawing UML diagrams based on a simple syntax.

item.title: Conference Partner
item.description: The Latest Information Technology Conference and Journal List

item.title: ConferenceList
item.description: List of conferences in ML/AI

item.title: Writing Science
item.description: As a scientist, you are a professional writer: your career is built on successful proposals and papers. Success isn’t defined by getting papers into print, but by getting them into the reader’s consciousness. Writing Science is built upon the idea that successful science writing tells a story. It uses that insight to discuss how to write more effectively.

item.title: Academic Phrasebank
item.description: The Academic Phrasebank is a general resource for academic writers. It aims to provide you with examples of some of the phraseological ‘nuts and bolts’ of writing organised according to the main sections of a research paper or dissertation.

item.title: Scolary
item.description: Find the best scientific tools for literally any stage of your research on Scolary.

item.title: AcademicLabs
item.description: Platform where you find research groups with their current research focus, publications, patents, clinical trials and projects. Research groups can also connect with industry easily here.

item.title: Scrapbox
item.description: A knowledge base that lets you capture notes, code, and research lightning-fast. Everything adds to a web of ideas that’s easy to use at scale.

item.title: Tectonic Typesetting System
item.description: Tectonic is a modernized, complete, self-contained TeX/LaTeX engine, powered by XeTeX and TeXLive. Tectonic makes LaTeX easy to compile.

item.title: RemNote
item.description: The first spaced-repetition powered note-taking tool that lets you structure knowledge exactly in the way you think about it.

item.title: Mind the Graph
item.description: Create beautiful scientific infographics with no effort

item.title: Antidote
item.description: Writing assistant with grammar, typography and style check, dictionaries, and writing guides.

item.title: Connected Papers
item.description: Explore connected papers in a visual graph

item.title: ScholarshipDB
item.description: scholarshipdb.net is a scholarship and research job search engine. The search engine employs state of the art technologies to collect latest information from various sources and present them to you in a single website.

item.title: Biorender
item.description: a powerful tool to draw scientific illustrations

item.title: Supernotes
item.description: card based note-taking with links between cards

item.title: Responsible Journals
item.description: Understand how the journals deal with submissions and how reviews are done

item.title: RAx - Your Personal Smart Research Assistant
item.description: Speed up literature analysis and comprehension with RAx. Smart assistant to explore, collate insights and organize your research easily.

item.title: Obsidian
item.description: note-taking with zettelkasten method (linked notes)

item.title: RoamResearch
item.description: Online note-taking with zettelkasten method (connected notes)

item.title: Notion
item.description: Write, plan, collaborate, and get organized — all in one tool. Write connected notes with rich format and Export to markdown, pdf, etc.

item.title: MarginNote
item.description: Efficient and visual note-taking and knowledge management while reading

item.title: Sci-Hub - Academic Papers for All
item.description: sh can helping people getting academic papers for free

item.title: Semantic Scholar
item.description: Semantic Scholar uses groundbreaking AI and engineering to understand the semantics of scientific literature to help Scholars discover relevant research.

item.title: Calendly
item.description: Calendly helps you schedule meetings without the back-and-forth emails

item.title: Doodle
item.description: It shouldn’t take 30 emails to schedule a 30-minute meeting. Book meetings faster with the smart scheduling power of Doodle

item.title: SciTools
item.description: Open tools for the analysis and visualisation of Earth science data

item.title: AMiner
item.description: AI Powered Research Career: rankings of researchers, academic institutes, and conferences; trends of research topics; datasets for research.

item.title: Academic Positions
item.description: All kinds of academic jobs listings.

item.title: European Funding Guide
item.description: Find money for your education in Europe.

item.title: Whimsical
item.description: Visual workspace, online tool for quick diagrams

item.title: Mathcha
item.description: Online WYSIWYG Formula Editor . Fast and powerful Editing features, inputting Normal text, Math symbols, and drawing Graph.

item.title: Detexify
item.description: Anyone who works with LaTeX knows how time-consuming it can be to find a symbol in symbols-a4.pdf that you just can’t memorize. Detexify is an attempt to simplify this search.

item.title: Unpaywall
item.description: An open database of free scholarly articles for you to legally download research papers for free.

item.title: On Being a Scientist: A Guide to Responsible Conduct in Research
item.description: A guide to responsible conduct in research.

item.title: Phylopic
item.description: Free silhouette images of animals, plants, and other life forms, available for reuse under a Public Domain or Creative Commons license.

item.title: Undraw
item.description: Open source illustrations

item.title: Unsplash
item.description: Free high resolution images.

item.title: Academicons
item.description: ICONs for academia

item.title: Asciinema
item.description: Command line recording and sharing.

item.title: Bashplotlib
item.description: plotting in the terminal using plaintext

item.title: Scholarpedia
item.description: the peer-reviewed open-access encyclopedia, where knowledge is curated by communities of experts.

item.title: Colorcet
item.description: Colorcet is a collection of perceptually uniform colormaps for use with Python plotting programs like bokeh, matplotlib, holoviews, and datashader based on the set of perceptually uniform colormaps created by Peter Kovesi at the Center for Exploration Targeting.

item.title: Zenodo
item.description: Make anything citable by publishing on Zenodo and getting a DOI code.

item.title: Codingame
item.description: Coding and having fun

item.title: Quiver
item.description: Programmer’s notebook, math + Markdown, code snippet.

item.title: itermplot
item.description: An awesome iTerm2 backend for Matplotlib, so you can plot directly in your terminal.

item.title: plotnine
item.description: Python visualization package that follows the grammar of graphics.

item.title: Seaborn
item.description: statistical data visualization in Python

item.title: D3.js
item.description: The most widely used javascript lib for visualizations in the browser.

item.title: Neurostars
item.description: StackOverflow style Q&A site for neuroinformatics.

item.title: Biostars
item.description: StackOverflow style Q&A site for bioinformatics.

item.title: Coffitivity
item.description: a rather simple but useful coffee shop noise library; premium has more three more soundtracks; elegant UI; scientific research powered

item.title: Noizio
item.description: a handy white noise tool that stays in your Mac status bar.

item.title: Noisli
item.description: free mixing of multiple tracks (which is similar to Soundrown but with much better UI). Users can save a customized setting for later use.

item.title: Rainy Mood
item.description: rainy day rainy mood, simple but with excellent white noise; a new beautiful soundtrack each day

item.title: Ten Rules Plosone
item.description: Series of quick “Ten Simple Rules” articles for research scientists to manage challenges in their careers. Number of articles are life-science specific, but rest the of articles are general enough for any researcher.

item.title: Zotero
item.description: An open source bibliography reference manager with syncing and BibTeX support.

item.title: Mendeley
item.description: A bibliography reference manager with cloud storage and BibTeX support.

item.title: Readcube/Papers
item.description: A all platform app for reference mamagement, note-taking, and more. The former Papers has been rebanded as ReadCube Papers.

item.title: OSF: Open Science Framework
item.description: OSF is a free, open platform to support your research and enable collaboration.

item.title: ORCID
item.description: A unique ID for researchers

item.title: Duecredit
item.description: duecredit is being conceived to address the problem of inadequate citation of scientific software and methods, and limited visibility of donation requests for open-source software.

item.title: Protocols Io
item.description: Create, share, and collaborate on protocals. Protocals.io is not only for biologist, it can be used for any protocals.

item.title: Iris AI
item.description: Speed up literature review

item.title: Arxiv Sanity
item.description: Web interface for browsing, search and filtering recent arxiv submissions

item.title: Scirate
item.description: free and open access scientific collaboration network

item.title: Paperscape
item.description: Paperscape is an interactive map that visualises the arXiv, an open, online repository for scientific research papers.

item.title: RStudio
item.description: IDE for R and Python

item.title: Self-Plagiarism
item.description: The reuse of significant, identical, or nearly identical portions of one’s own work without acknowledging that one is doing so or citing the original work is sometimes described as self-plagiarism.

item.title: Speaker Deck
item.description: Share your slides with others and find interesting slides.

item.title: Gimp
item.description: Create and edit images

item.title: Inkscape
item.description: Create SVG graphs

item.title: Mathematica Slide Show
item.description: Mathematica can be used to create interative slides.

item.title: slides.com
item.description: Make dynamical slides with synchronous presentations over all devices.

item.title: Amphetamine App
item.description: Amphetamine keeps your Mac awake during presentations.

item.title: Gliffy
item.description: Diagram software that works as hard as your team.

item.title: Processon
item.description: Online Mindmap, FlowChart, MindMap, UI, UML and Network charts with Collabration in Real-time.

item.title: Plectica
item.description: Plectica is helps us managing our mind. It is more flexible than mindmaps.

item.title: Overleaf/Overleaf
item.description: Overleaf and ShareLaTeX are Online LaTeX editors with collaborations, history, chat, and submission.

item.title: Papeeria
item.description: Online LaTeX editor

item.title: Authorea
item.description: Write and submit your papers online.

item.title: HackMD
item.description: Online markdown editor with collaborations and sharing built-in.

item.title: Findings App
item.description: Your research assistant & lab notebook, all in one app.

item.title: Github Pages
item.description: Hosted directly from your GitHub repository. Just edit, push, and your changes are live. Integrated with Jekyll and turns markdown posts automatically. Jekyll is a tool for blogging.

item.title: Read the Docs
item.description: Read the Docs simplifies software documentation by automating building, versioning, and hosting of your docs for you.

item.title: De-Jargonizer
item.description: The De-Jargonizer is an automated jargon identification program aimed at helping scientists and science communication trainers improve and adapt vocabulary use for a variety of audiences.

item.title: Proselint
item.description: Proselint is a linter for English prose.

item.title: Rousseau
item.description: Lightweight proofreader in JS

item.title: Write Good
item.description: Naive linter for English prose

item.title: Visual Studio Code
item.description: Universal editor with an extension marketplace.

item.title: Hemingway App
item.description: Hemingway App makes your writing bold and clear. It highlights complex sentences, point out passive voice, and suggests alternative words.

item.title: Gitbook
item.description: Online tool for personal and team knowledge management.

item.title: Sphinx
item.description: Sphinx is a tool for python code documentation generation. It is also a very good tool to take digital notes since it supports images, equations, tables, code blocks, etc.

item.title: Color Calculator
item.description: Generate color palettes based on harnomy

item.title: ColorBrewer
item.description: Color palete advice for maps

item.title: Paletton
item.description: Generate color palettes

item.title: IQSS: The Institute for Quantitative Social Science
item.description: The Institute for Quantitative Social Science

item.title: ICPSR: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research
item.description: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

item.title: OpenEI
item.description: Linked energy information on hundreds of topics crowdsourced from industry and government agencies.

item.title: Archaeology Data Service
item.description: Certified repository for Archaeology data

item.title: MAST: Barbara A. Mikulski Archive for Space Telescopes
item.description: MAST: Barbara A. Mikulski Archive for Space Telescopes

item.title: new MAST: Barbara A. Mikulski Archive for Space Telescopes
item.description: MAST: Barbara A. Mikulski Archive for Space Telescopes

item.title: USVAO: US Virtual Astronomical Observatory
item.description: US Virtual Astronomical Observatory

item.title: GEOSS Portal
item.description: Earth science data

item.title: NCEI
item.description: Weather, climate, coasts, oceans, and geophysics etc

item.title: Genbank
item.description: Genetic sequence database

item.title: Figshare
item.description: Figshare allows us store, share and discover research data and other materials.

item.title: Dryad
item.description: The Dryad Digital Repository stores curated data.

item.title: Wolfram Alpha
item.description: Wolfram Alpha is an AI assistant that does data analysis in a smart way.

item.title: Geogebra
item.description: Geogebra is the classical. GeoGebra can be used for precise charting as well as simple calculations.

item.title: Desmos
item.description: Desmos is a simple online charting tool that creates interactive charts.

item.title: Graph.tk
item.description: Graph.tk is a dead simple online charting tool that creates interactive charts.

item.title: Plotly
item.description: Plotly is a set of open-source graphing libraries. Plotly is the goto library to make interactive charts in Python, R, or JavaScript.

item.title: Mathematica Online
item.description: The online version of Mathematica!

item.title: Cocalc
item.description: A toolkit for coding and writing online. The UI is a bit outdated but the services are real hardcore.

item.title: Datalore
item.description: Datalore is hosted jupyter notebook

item.title: Azure Notebooks
item.description: Azure notebooks is simply a hosted Jupyter notebook.

item.title: Kaggle
item.description: Kaggle is a competition platform that bundles online computing Jupyter notebooks and data management.

item.title: Next Journal
item.description: NextJournal is the notebook for reproducible research. NextJournal provides poly-language notebooks and beautiful UI.

item.title: Google Colab
item.description: Google Colab is an online version of Jupyter Notebook which allows us to use free computation powers from Google and storage on Google Drive. Google Colab also comes with free GPU hours.

item.title: Taskade
item.description: Taskade is a beautiful project management tool for both personal use and team collaborations. Taskade ships with task management and note-taking tools.

item.title: Todoist
item.description: Multi-platform tool to track and analyze tasks.

item.title: Anydo
item.description: Anydo comes with a very useful daily review and reminder. Anydo also integrates with its own utilities such as calenders.

item.title: Evernote
item.description: Not so lightweight but still very good for managing life especially since it has got a lot of integrations from a lot of other services.

item.title: Google Keep
item.description: Google Keep is light-weight. It comes with powerful search. The App ships with simple drawing and handwriting.

item.title: Microsoft To Do
item.description: Task management tool backed by Microsoft and works on most platforms.

item.title: Pomotodo
item.description: A mix of todo list and pomodoro timer, with sync across devices and weekly report.

item.title: GitHub
item.description: GitHub is the most popular platform for git with social and collaborations built-in.

item.title: Gitlab
item.description: Gitlab provides git hosting, collaborations, social, automations, and more. GitLab can be both cloud-based and self-hosted using its opensource code.
